results.title: Multicultural education: a teaching style
results.creator_credit: Wayne Threm, David Arnold, Dennis Hicks and Media Five Film
results.brief_description: Looks at the change from the traditional “melting pot” theory to an appreciation of cultural pluralism. Several classroom approaches are demonstrated which encourage ethnic groups to maintain their identity and pride and at the same time learn mutual respect. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wayne Threm, David Arnold, Dennis Hicks and Media Five Film

results.title: Mosaic
results.creator_credit: Louise Jonas, Rob McCubbin and AVRB Film Unit
results.brief_description: Harold Freedman describes the different processes he undertook in constructing the mosaic at the State Offices, Geelong, Victoria, from the painting of the cartoon to final cleaning and grouting. The completed mosaic is shown in detail at the end of the film.

results.title: Indonesia calling
results.creator_credit: Joris Ivens, Waterside Workers' Federation of Australia. Film Unit. and Catherine Duncan
results.brief_description: Appointed as film commissioner to the Dutch Indies, it was intended that Ivens would create educational films on behalf of the Dutch government and would document the liberation of Indonesia from Japanese occupation. When it became obvious that the Dutch government had no interest in granting independance to Indonesia, Ivens resigned. Working clandestinely, he recorded this film in support of the struggle by the Indonesian people to gain their independance. The film shows efforts by Australian dockworkers and striking Indonesian seamen to prevent the shipment of arms and ammunition to Indonesia aboard Dutch vessels. Cinematography, Marion Michelle. Editing, Joris Ivens and Jock Levy. Script, Joris Ivens and Catherine Duncan. Commentary, Peter Finch.

results.title: The Hungry miles
results.creator_credit: Jerome Levy, Keith Gow, Norma Disher and Waterside Workers' Federation of Australia. Film Unit.
results.brief_description: A passionate survey of the struggles and achievements of the Waterside Workers Federation including some striking scenes of the depression (reconstructed by the WWF Film Unit with amateur actors), showing the impact of the economic hardships of the 1930s on the union and its members.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jerome Levy, Keith Gow, Norma Disher and Waterside Workers’ Federation of Australia. Film Unit.

results.title: Documentary: 1948 - 1976
results.creator_credit: Herman J. Engel, Sonya Freidman and Texture Films
results.brief_description: Part three of a three part compilation history of the documentary film. This part presents films from 1948-1976. Each sequence offers an important example of documentary film style, content and construction. Before eac of the documentaries presented, there is an introduction that place the film historically.

results.title: Trucks in our neighbourhood: a first film
results.creator_credit: Dan McCarroll, Frank Stokes, BFA Educational Media and Film Associates
results.brief_description:
Shows the various trucks that might come to the neighbourhood. Also shows the workers who drive them as they provide services, make deliveries and repairs and do the general work needed to keep a neighbourhood running smoothly.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Circle of the sun = Le Soleil perdu
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: At the 1961 gathering of the Blood Indians of Alberta the exciting spectacle of the Sun Dance was captured on film for the first time. The film also reflects the predicament of the young generation, those who relinquished their ties with their own people but have not yet found a firm place in a changing world. (Awards include: London, Brussels, Toronto)
